hero.main: Your oil logistics partner in Congo

about.title2: Discover our history, vision and values
about.presentationText: SCLOG ensures the storage and bulk transportation of liquid hydrocarbons throughout the Republic of Congo, while adhering to the highest safety and quality standards, as evidenced by its ISSSRS Level 3 and JIG certifications. The products handled include diesel, gasoline, Jet-A1 (aviation fuel), fuel oil, and kerosene. These hydrocarbons mainly originate from CORAF refinery production and imports carried out by SNPC and marketing companies.
about.visionText: To be the benchmark for operational excellence and innovation in the storage and logistics of liquid petroleum products in Congo and Central Africa.

services.intro: Thanks to its network of distributed depots and diversified logistics resources, SCLOG ensures smooth, secure and tailored management throughout the country.

cards.title: Storage
cards.desc: We store products from CORAF production and imports from SNPC and our clients on their behalf. For this, we have 8 oil depots throughout Congo.

cards.title: Bulk transport
cards.desc: We transfer petroleum products between our 8 depots using various means: tanker trucks, tank wagons, and barges.

cards.title: Tanker truck loading
cards.desc: Products stored on behalf of our clients are then loaded by us into tanker trucks at their request.

cards.title: Ship or barge bunkering
cards.desc: Our services also extend to bunkering activities at the request of our clients who own products.

logistique.title: Oil Logistics in Congo
logistique.section1: Oil logistics in Congo is based on a structured process ensuring fuel supply throughout the country. Products come either from the CORAF refinery or are imported by marketers using ships and barges by sea or river. These petroleum products are received and stored in the import depots of Pointe-Noire and Brazzaville.
logistique.section2: SCLOG then ensures their transfer to inland depots by tanker trucks, barges, or tank wagons. This logistics organization efficiently serves the different regions, ensuring a constant supply even in the most remote areas.
logistique.section3: At the request of its clients (marketers) such as SNPC-D, TotalEnergies, Afric, Puma, X-Oil, etc., SCLOG loads the products into tanker trucks. These companies handle the final distribution to service stations, industrial clients, and other strategic infrastructures, thus ensuring a constant supply throughout the country.

steps.title: Recruitment decision
steps.desc: SCLOG develops its recruitments taking into account the needs identified by each department and budgetary objectives. Any request is validated by General Management before implementation.

steps.title: Recruitment process
steps.desc: Job offers are carefully drafted and published through various channels. The selection includes written tests and interviews. Selected candidates complete a 6-month trial period before permanent employment, followed by full integration.

steps.title: Integration
steps.desc: Each hired employee receives the SCLOG welcome booklet, including our code of ethics and internal regulations. SCLOG also handles procedures with CNSS and ACPE for administrative compliance.
